summary: This document is an email chain from April 2019 discussing a call from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) regarding SDNY's open criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The SDNY is seeking access to evidence gathered by the Miami FBI from the prior SDFL Epstein investigation, but requires a '6e letter' for the FBI to release the materials. The SDFL office, being recused, seeks to connect SDNY with the new prosecutor handling the old case.

persons.name: Jeff Epstein
persons.context: The open criminal matter in SDNY involves Jeff Epstein. The email discusses SDNY's efforts to obtain evidence from the prior SDFL investigation into him.

events.title: SDNY calls SDFL about Epstein evidence
events.description: The Criminal Chief of SDNY calls the SDFL to discuss obtaining evidence from the Miami FBI related to the prior SDFL Epstein investigation for SDNY's open criminal matter.

events.title: Email coordination on evidence transfer
events.description: Email chain discusses the need for a '6e letter' to authorize the Miami FBI to send grand jury materials to the SDNY FBI, and the SDFL's recusal means they should not issue it.

keyFacts: SDNY had an open criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein as of April 2019.
SDNY was seeking evidence from the prior Epstein investigation conducted by the Southern District of Florida and the Miami FBI.
The Miami FBI required a '6e letter' (likely referring to Rule 6(e) governing grand jury secrecy) to release materials to SDNY.
The SDFL USAO was recused from the underlying Epstein criminal matter and thus could not authorize the evidence transfer.
The correspondence aims to connect SDNY with the new prosecutor handling the old SDFL Epstein case to facilitate the evidence request.
